channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-6706] Relogin behavior for RPC clients could be improved
item.description: Currently, the relogin in the RPC client happens on only a SaslException. But we have seen cases where other exceptions are thrown (like IllegalStateException when the client's ticket is invalid). This jira is to fix that behavior.
item.summary: Relogin behavior for RPC clients could be improved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Attaching a patch for the Y20 branch. "Exception" is caught and a relogin is attempted. We were debating whether to have relogin done outside the exception block before doing a saslConnect. But even in that case, we need to be able to handle exceptions since some other thread might be currently using the subject credentials that we are just about to destroy (in relogin) and that thread should retry the connection after a relogin. In any case the exception handling is required.
patch looks good.

One note on the patch is that this is a stop-gap solution (and is lame, in that it banks on exception handling to do relogins). The ideal solution is to use the Refreshable interface and in that case we don't have to rely on exceptions being thrown before attempting relogins. However, as Owen noted in http://tinyurl.com/y6putxk, the patch that uses the Refreshable interface doesn't seem to be working as expected.
Attaching a patch that fixes a bug in the earlier version of the Y20s patch. Not for commit.
Updates the relogin behavior even more. Closes the RPC socket on a connection failure. (patch for Y20s).
FIX on top .
addressed comments from Devaraj
removed unneeded imports.

Patch for trunk.
Incorporates HADOOP-6718 and HADOOP-6776

+1, patch looks good. Couple nits.

It's better to call disposeSasl() immediately after closeConnection() in handleSaslConnectionFailure().

Please don't format lines you're not changing otherwise. This will make patch easier to read.
